skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation and tooling skill for creating Claude skills. It contains utility scripts for skill initialization, validation, and packaging. The scripts have controlled filesystem access limited to skill creation directories and make no network calls.

low_findings.title: Filesystem access for skill creation
low_findings.description:
The init_skill.py and package_skill.py scripts create directories and files on the filesystem. This is expected behavior for a skill creation tool. Filesystem access is limited to user-specified directories and uses safe Path operations.

Code example (init_skill.py:215):
```python
skill_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=False)
```

Code example (package_skill.py:73):
```python
zipf.write(file_path, arcname)
```

content.value_statement: Creating Claude skills from scratch can be challenging without guidance on structure, resources, and packaging. This skill provides a step-by-step process for building, validating, and distributing skills that extend Claude with specialized knowledge and workflows.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through the complete skill creation workflow from concept to packaged skill
Provide templates and best practices for writing effective SKILL.md documentation
Include utility scripts for skill initialization, validation, and packaging
Explain progressive disclosure design for managing context efficiently
Document patterns for organizing scripts, references, and assets
Support both workflow-based and task-based skill structures
limitations: Does not execute user code or access external APIs
Does not provide runtime environment for skill testing
Does not include pre-built skills or templates for specific domains
Scripts are for skill development only, not general automation

use_cases.title: Build Custom Skill Extensions
use_cases.description: Create specialized skills that extend Claude with domain-specific knowledge, APIs, or workflow automation for your projects.

use_cases.title: Standardize Team Workflows
use_cases.description: Package team-specific procedures, coding standards, and best practices into skills that ensure consistent AI assistance across your organization.

use_cases.title: Share Expertise via Skills
use_cases.description: Distribute specialized knowledge or creative workflows as reusable skills that others can install and benefit from.

prompt_templates.title: New Skill from Scratch
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a new skill for a specific domain
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill called [skill-name] for [use-case description]. Follow the skill creation process from the skill-creator guide. Walk me through understanding the skill requirements, planning reusable contents, initializing the skill structure, and writing effective SKILL.md documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Package Existing Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a skill folder at [path]. Help me validate it using the quick_validate script, fix any issues, and package it into a distributable .skill file using the packaging workflow.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor Skill Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: My current skill [skill-name] has [describe issue]. Review the skill against the progressive disclosure design principle and help me restructure it. Move detailed reference material to separate files and keep SKILL.md focused on core instructions.

prompt_templates.title: Design Multi-Framework Skill
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a skill supporting multiple frameworks
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a skill that supports multiple frameworks or variants. Use the domain-specific organization pattern to structure references by variant. Include clear guidance in SKILL.md for selecting the right variant and loading appropriate reference documentation.

output_examples.input: Help me create a PDF processing skill that can merge, split, and extract text from PDFs.
output: **Skill Structure:** Task-based skill with scripts for each operation
**SKILL.md Structure**: Overview ‚Üí Quick Start ‚Üí Merge PDFs ‚Üí Split PDFs ‚Üí Extract Text

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines by moving detailed reference material to separate files in the references/ directory
Include concrete examples in SKILL.md that show realistic user requests and expected outputs
Use the progressive disclosure pattern - only load resources into context when Claude determines they are needed
anti_patterns: Including all documentation in SKILL.md instead of using references/ for detailed material that is rarely needed
Creating README.md, INSTALLATION_GUIDE.md, or other auxiliary documentation files that duplicate information
Using overly verbose explanations when concise examples would communicate the same concept more clearly

faq.question: What tools support skill-creator?
faq.answer: The skill-creator works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Skills created with it can be installed and used across these platforms.

faq.question: What is the maximum size for a skill?
faq.answer: SKILL.md should be under 500 lines. Reference files can be larger but should use grep patterns for efficient loading.

faq.question: How do I integrate skills with my codebase?
faq.answer: Include scripts/ for executable utilities, references/ for documentation, and assets/ for templates. Scripts can be executed directly by Claude without loading into context.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using skill-creator?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill-creator scripts only access filesystem paths you explicitly specify. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why is my skill validation failing?
faq.answer: Common issues: missing YAML frontmatter, invalid name format (must be hyphen-case), description over 1024 characters, or unexpected frontmatter keys.

faq.question: How does skill-creator compare to other skill templates?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on the complete creation workflow including planning, progressive disclosure design, and packaging. It provides scripts not just templates.
